question_text: Which of the following BEST explains the purpose of having both a 20+4 pin connector and a separate 4- or 8-pin EPS connector on a PSU?
answer_options: To allow for different case form factors
To separately power the CPU from the motherboard
To isolate GPU voltage from chipset voltage
correct_answer: To separately power the CPU from the motherboard
explanation: The EPS connector (4- or 8-pin) provides direct power to the CPU voltage regulators, while the 20+4 connector powers the mainboard logic and peripherals.
